items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details:
A public hearing is opened to allow an opportunity for public input regarding the 2010-2011 contract opener proposal submitted by the San Jose/Evergreen Community College District  and the Faculty Association, AFT 6157 at the July 13, 2010 meeting of the Board.  The openers are:
	 
Article   8 - Full-Time Faculty Salary
Article 17 - Benefits
Article 18 - Retirement
Article 32 - Term
The District and the Faculty Association reserves the right to add, amend, delete or make changes.
	 
A recommendation that the Board of Trustees hold a public hearing regarding the  2010-2011 contract opener proposal submitted by the San Jose/Evergreen Community College District and the Faculty Association, AFT 6157 at July 13, 2010 meeting of the Board.  After the public has an opportunity to express itself, it is recommended that the Board adopt the opener proposals.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are:   short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Short-Term Hourly, Substitute, Professional Expert & Athletic Support Services personnel actions as submitted.

items.item_details:
Education Code 81655 stipulates that no contract is an enforceable obligation of the district until it has been approved by the Board of Trustees. District policy adopted on April 10, 2007 establishes the authority of certain administrators to approve contracts under the bid limit prior to formal Board approval. All contracts and purchase orders exceeding the bid limit (currently $78,500) should have prior board approval as a separate Board item.
	 
This consent item presents for Board approval: all purchase orders for this period which includes all purchase orders for administratively-approved contracts exceeding $750 as well as any additional contracts that are not executed by way of purchase order as deemed appropriate to be added by purchasing.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees ratify the contracts.

items.item_details:
This project is currently in progress and involves the modernization of the Cedro and P. E. Buildings.  The scope of work included in this change order covers additional destructive testing required by the Division of the State Architect to close out the original gymnasium project.  The additional work included the testing of the existing structural systems including the steel beams and concrete columns in accordance with provisions of Title 24. This additional work is a code requirement.
	 
Staff and the Construction Manager have reviewed the costs submitted for these changes and recommend approval.

items.item_details:
Existing law under AB 1000 permitted certain Community College Districts, including San José Evergreen, to enter into Design-Build Contracts for projects of over $10 million. On October 11, 2007, the Legislature, with approval of the Governor, approved an amendment under SB 614, which allows any Community College District to enter into and execute a design-build contract for any project over $2.5 million.
  
A determination by the Board of Trustees is required to ensure that this project delivery is in the best interest of the District to meet any of the following objectives:
Reduce comparable project costs
Expedite the project’s completion
Provide features not achievable through the traditional design-bid-build method
Education Code, Section 81702 - 06 has also been amended to allow the use of design-build project delivery method.
	 
Remaining projects in Measure G that may be suitable for design-build are:
SJCC - Gymnasium Replacement project and the Milpitas Education Center.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees adopt a resolution to use Design-Build as a project delivery method in accordance with the guidelines set forth in Ed Code Section 81706.
items.item_text: Resolution to Adopt a Design-Build Project Delivery Method – Multiple Projects District Wide

items.item_details: Chancellor Cepeda and Vice Chancellor Hawk will provide a budget update.
Chancellor Cepeda will provide a Legislative Update.
Update on bond measure.

In 2009, the Office of Research and Institutional Effectiveness identified nine steps that influence student success for EVC & SJCC students.  Specifically, students should complete a placement assessment, orientation, counseling services, financial considerations, class enrollment, class attendance, classroom teaching and learning, class success and college-level course completion.  This presentation will focus on the third step of the student success process, counseling and advisement.

District Procedure AP 6550 stipulates that the District shall report sales proceeds to the Board of Trustees at least once annually.
 
This information item presents the proceeds of surplus items for Fiscal Year 2009/2010.
